intro: Gymnostoma australianum, commonly known as the Australian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange in color. The leaves are lanceolate and have a smooth, waxy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
